thread.title: Aguero penalty gives Man City 2-1 win over 'Gladbach
thread.title_full: Aguero penalty gives Man City 2-1 win over 'Gladbach

title: Aguero penalty gives Man City 2-1 win over 'Gladbach
text:
Last-minute Aguero penalty gives Man City a 2-1 win over 'Gladbach in Champions League THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   4:51   4:51   
People: 
Germany (196) 

MOENCHENGLADBACH, Germany — Sergio Aguero scored a last-minute penalty to give Manchester City a 2-1 victory at Borussia Moenchengladbach as the English side got the first win of its Champions League campaign Wednesday. 
Aguero was fouled by United States defender Fabian Johnson in the 89th minute and sent 'Gladbach keeper Yann Sommer the wrong way for the visitors' first win. Both sides lost their opening games in Group D. 
Lars Stindl opened the scoring in the 54th for the home side, which was playing European Cup football at home for the first time in 37 years, only for Nicolas Otamendi to equalize with a deflected effort in the 65th after Martin Demichelis' initial attempts was hooked out by a defender. 
Juventus defeated Sevilla 2-0 in the other group game.
